net.corda.core.utilities

Class OpaqueBytes

  • net.corda.core.utilities.ByteSequence
    • net.corda.core.utilities.OpaqueBytes
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DigitalSignature, PrivacySalt, SecureHash, SerializedBytes

    public class OpaqueBytes
extends ByteSequence

    A simple class that wraps a byte array and makes the equals/hashCode/toString methods work as you actually expect. In an ideal JVM this would be a value type and be completely overhead free. Project Valhalla is adding such functionality to Java, but it won't arrive for a few years yet!

    • Field Detail

      • Companion

        public static net.corda.core.utilities.OpaqueBytes.Companion Companion

    • Constructor Detail

      • OpaqueBytes

        public OpaqueBytes(@NotNull
                   kotlin.Array[] bytes)

        A simple class that wraps a byte array and makes the equals/hashCode/toString methods work as you actually expect. In an ideal JVM this would be a value type and be completely overhead free. Project Valhalla is adding such functionality to Java, but it won't arrive for a few years yet!

    • Method Detail

      • getBytes

        @NotNull
public kotlin.Array[] getBytes()

        The bytes are always cloned so that this object becomes immutable. This has been done to prevent tampering with entities such as class SecureHash and class PrivacySalt, as well as preserve the integrity of our hash constants net.corda.core.crypto.SecureHash.zeroHash and net.corda.core.crypto.SecureHash.allOnesHash.

        Cloning like this may become a performance issue, depending on whether or not the JIT compiler is ever able to optimise away the clone. In which case we may need to revisit this later.

        See Also:
        class SecureHash, class PrivacySalt

      • of

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static OpaqueBytes of(@NotNull
                                                  byte... b)

        Create class OpaqueBytes from a sequence of Byte values.

        See Also:
        class OpaqueBytes, Byte
